summary: Email correspondence between a DOJ OIG Senior Special Agent and Associate Warden Forrest regarding a request for documentation and an interview about the August 2019 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York. The warden clarifies his start date and lack of oversight of certain departments during the relevant timeframe.

keyFacts: Associate Warden Forrest began working at MCC New York on July 8, 2019, and assumed responsibility of Correctional Services on August 8, 2019, two days before Epstein was found unresponsive.
Forrest states he did not have oversight of the Facilities Department during the dates in question and was not informed of any systemic camera issues at MCC.

The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is actively investigating the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death, specifically requesting documentation on the incident, a prior inmate transfer, and camera system issues.
The email chain shows coordination for a voluntary interview, with the OIG providing a warnings and assurances form to the employee.
